The Lord will ſtain the pride of all glory, and bring into contempt all the honourable of the earth; Iſa. 23.9. Jer. 13.9.
All the proude, and all that do wickedly ſhall be as ſtubble, and the day that cometh ſhall burn them up; Mal. 4.1.

div.head: Rebuke.
div.p:
Prov. 9:8. Levit. 19:17. Prov. 13:1.
Eccleſ. 7:5. Prov: 24:25. Amos 5:10. Prov. 27:5. Luke 17:3. Prov: 28:23. 1 Tim: 5:20. 2 Tim: 4:2. Tit: 1:13. Revel: 3:19. Tit: 2:15.

div.head: Reiected.
div.p: 1 Sam. 8.7. Jer. 8, 9. 1 Sam. 10.19. Jer. 6.30. Hoſea 4.6. Luke 7.30. Titus 3.10.

div.head: Of Ioy, and Reioycing.
div.p: It is the duty of the Saints and ſervants of God to Ioy and Reioyce; Levit 25.40. Deut. 12.7.16.11. Deut. 26.11, 27. Eccleſ. 3.12. Gal. 5.22. Eccleſ. 9.7. Luke 1, 58. Rom. 12.15. Pſal. 68.3. 1 Theſ. 5.16. Pſal. 132.9.

Their Ioy and Reioycing is not a Jovial vain laughter, as carnal men plead, but their Reioycing is in the Lord, which Ioy the world are ſtrangers to; Prov. 14.10. Pſal. 9.2. 1 Sam. 2.1. Pſal. 32.11. Iſa. 61.10. Pſal. 33.1. Joel 2.23. Pſal. 35.9. Hab. 3.18. Pſal. 97.12. Rom. 5.11. Phil. 3.3. 1. Theſ. 1.6. Romans 14.17. Phil. 4.4. Luke 1.47.

The ſervants of God have great Ioy, & reioycing in the Lord, though they are in
trouble, perſecutions, and afflictions; Acts 5:41. 2 Cor 7:4. Acts 13:50, 52. 2 Cor. 6:10. Col. 1:24. Acts 16:25. 2 Theſ. 1:6. 2 Cor. 8:2. Heb. 10:34. 1 Pet. 1:6. Jam. 1.2. 1 Pet. 4:16.

div.head: The matter in which the Saints Reioycing chiefly conſiſteth.
div.p: Gods Commandements is matter of great Ioy to them; Pſal. 119:14. Jer. 15:16. Pſal. 119:162. Pſal. 119:111.
It is Ioy to the juſt, to do judgment; Prov. 21.15.
Their Ioy is in having a godly Converſation in the World, toward God and men; 2 Cor. 1:12.
They reioyce in hope of the glory of God; Rom. 5:2.12:12.
In ſeeing and hearing of others grow in grace, and walk in the way of God; 2 Cor. 1:14. Phil. 4:10. 2 Cor. 7:13, 16. 2 John 4. 2 Tim. 1:4. 3 John 4. Philem. 7.
The return of Iſraels Captivity is matter of Ioy; Pſal. 53:6.
It is matter of Ioy to all People, that a Saviour, was born unto them; Luke 2:10.11.
That Chriſt is frequently preached; Phil. 1:18.
Chriſts going to the Father, is Ioy to the Saints, becauſe he will come again; John 14:28.
That their names are written in the Book of Life; Luke 10.20.

div.head: Reaſons why Perſons ſhould reioyce in the Lord.
div.p: Chriſt Commanded it; Mat. 5:12.
Chriſt left his diſciples many promiſes to that very end; John 15:11. John 16:22, 24.
The Apoſtles put the Saints in mind of thoſe promiſes to that very end, that their Ioy might be full; 1 John 1.4. 2 John 12.
It is a fruit of the ſpirit; Gal. 5:22.
The Ioy of the Lord is the Saints ſtrength; Nehem. 8.10.
God meeteth thoſe that Reioyce, and work Righteouſneſs; Iſa. 64:5.
His wrath is againſt thoſe that ſerve him not with Ioyfulneſs; Deut. 28.47, 48.
Becauſe the Lord Reioyceth in his people that walk in his wayes; Deut. 30:9. Iſa. 62.5. Pſal. 104:31. Iſa. 65:19. Jer. 32, 41.
The Angels in Heaven reioyce at the converſion of Sinners; Luke 15.7.10.
Becauſe God is the Saints defender; Pſal. 5:11.28:7.
Becauſe the Lord conſidereth them in trouble and adverſity; Pſal. 31.7.
Becauſe he is their avenger on their enemies, Pſal 35.9.58.10.

p.hi: What the people of God ſhould not reioyce in.

div.p: Not becauſe the Divels are ſubject to them; Luke 10.20.
Not in vain talking and fooliſh boaſting; Jam: 4:16.
They muſt not reioyce in iniquity; 1 Cor: 13.6.
Reioyce not when thine enemy falleth, neither be glad when he ſtumbleth; Pro: 24:17. Job 31:29. Pſal: 35.26.
They ſhould not reioyce becauſe their wealth is great, nor becauſe their hand hath gotten much gain; Job 31.25.

p.hi: What wicked men reioyce in.

div.p: They reioyce in boaſting of things that are vain; Jam: 4:16.
They reioyce in things of nought; Amos 6:13.
They reioyce to do evil, and de light themſelves in the frowardneſs of the wicked; Prov: 2:14. Jer: 11:15.
They reioyce when God calls to weeping; and to mourning; Iſa: 22:13.
They reiovce at things of antiquity, and of a long ſtanding; Iſa: 23.7.

div.head: Of Repentance.
div.p: Repentance commanded and exhorted to; Mat. 3:2. Mark 1:15. Mat. 4:17. Luke 24.47. Mark 6:12. Acts 2:38. Mat: 9:13. Acts 3:19. Heb. 6:1. Acts 17:30. 2 Pet: 3:9. Acts 20:21.
Perſons may make a ſhow of Repentance, & yet their hearts not be right in the ſight of God; Jer. 2:20. Hoſea 7:14. Jer: 3:10. Mal. 2:13.

div.head: True Repentance conſiſteth in theſe following particulars.
div.p: 1 In confeſſing and acknowledging of ſin; Pſal. 32.5. Jer: 3.13. Pſal: 51:3. Hoſea 5:15. Prov: 28:13. Jer. 14:20.
2 In an utter forſaking and abhoring of ſin; Iſa: 55:7. Ezek: 14.6. Jer. 4:3. Prov: 28:13. Iſa: 1:16. Ezek: 18:30. Heb: 6:1. Dan: 4:27. Job 42:6. 2 Cor: 7:11. Heb: 9:14. Jonah 3:8.
3 In turning to God and his way, with the whole heart and mind; Prov: 1:23. Iſa: 55:7. Deut: 30:2. Iſa: 31:6. Jer. 31:19. Joel 2:12. Lam: 3:40. Acts 26:20.
4 In bringing forth good fruit, meet for repentance; Mat. 3:8. Iſa. 5.4. Luk. 3.8. Act. 26:20.

div.head: Reaſons why men and women ſhould repent.
div.p: Becauſe Chriſt came not to call the righteous, but ſinners to repentance; Mat: 9:13.
Becauſe the goodneſs of God, leads perſons to repentance; Rom: 2:4. 2 Pet: 3:9.
It is the work of Gods people to inſtruct perſons, that God may give them repentance; 2 Tim: 2.25.
Becauſe God complains of ſuch who neglect repentance; Jer: 8:6. Revel: 9:21.

div.head: The excellency of repentance.
div.p: By repentance God will repent of the judgments, he thought to bring upon a people; Jer: 18:8. Joel 2:13. Jonah 3:10.
There is joy in Heaven at the repentance of ſinners; Luke 15:7, 10.
It is the way to have our ſins blotted out; Acts 2:38. Luke 24:47. Acts 3:19.5:31.

div.head: Danger of neglecting repentance.
div.p: Except ye repent ye ſhall all periſh; Luke 13:3, 5.
Without repentance no remiſſion of ſin; Acts 8:22.
Churches if found in ſin without repentance, God will remove their Candleſtick; Revel: 2:5.
Without repentance ſin will prove our ruin; Ezek: 18:30.
God will fight againſt thoſe that repent not, with the ſword of his mouth; Rovel: 2:16.
Without repentance great tribulations are threatned, eſpecially when God gives ſpace to repent; Revel: 2:21, 22.

div.head: Of the Reſurrection.
The Dead ſhall Riſe.
div.p: Though worms deſtroy this body, yet in my fleſh ſhall I ſee God; Job 19.26.
But God will redeem my Soul, from the power of the Grave; Pſal. 49.15.

Thy Dead men ſhall live together, with my Dead body ſhall they ariſe; awake and ſing, ye that dwell in the duſt, for thy dew is as the dew of hearbs, and the earth ſhall caſt out the Dead; Iſa. 26.19.
Now that the Dead are raiſed, even Moſes ſhewed at the buſh, when he calleth the Lord, the God of Abraham, Iſaac, and Jacob; for he is not a God of the Dead but of the Living; Luke 20.37.
Martha ſaith unto him, I know that he ſhall riſe again, in the Reſurrection at the laſt day; John 11.24.
The Phariſees confeſs there is a Reſurrection of the Body from the Dead; Acts 23.8.
Now if Chriſt be preached, that he roſe from the dead, how ſay ſome among you, that there is no Reſurrection of the dead; 1 Cor. 15.12.
Others were tortured, not accepting deliverance, that they might obtain a better Reſurrection; Heb. 11.35.
And God hath both raiſed up the Lord, and will alſo raiſe up us by his own power; 1 Cor. 6.14.

div.head: All ſhall be raiſed, both the juſt and the unjuſt.
div.p: And many which ſleep in the duſt of the earth, ſhall awake, ſome to everlaſting life, and ſome to ſhame, and everlaſting contempt; Dan. 12.2.
And before him ſhall be gathered all nations, and he ſhall ſeperate one from another, as a Shepheard devideth his ſheep from the Goats; Mat. 25.32.

Marvel not at this, for the hour is coming, in the which all that are in the graves ſhall hear his voyce, and ſhall come forth, they that have done good unto the reſurrection of life, and they that have done evil, unto the reſurrection of damnation; John 5.28, 29.
And have hope towards God, which they themſelves alſo allow, that there ſhall be a Reſurrection of the dead, both of the juſt and unjuſt; Acts 24.15.
And the Sea gave up the dead which were in it, and Death and Hell delivered up the dead which were in them, and they were judged every man according to their works; Revel. 20.13.
But ſome man will ſay, how are the dead raiſed, and with what body do they come; 1 Cor. 15.35.
Anſw. The ſame body which men have here in this world, only they ſhall be changed.
Though worms deſtroy this body, yet in my fleſh ſhall I ſee God, whom I ſhall ſee for my ſelf, and mine eyes ſhall behold, and not another, though my reins be conſumed within me; Job 19.26, 27.
Therefore my heart is glad, and my glory rejoyceth, my fleſh alſo ſhall reſt in hope, for thou wilt not leave my ſoul in Hell; Pſal. 16.9, 10.
So alſo is the Reſurrection of the dead, it is ſown in weakneſs, it is raiſed in power, it is ſown a natural body, it is raiſed a ſpiritual body; 1 Cor. 15.42, 43, 44.

div.head: The reaſons why the ſame body of fleſh, ſhall riſe again.
div.p:
That every one may receive the things done in his body, that the ſame body may receive joy or puniſhment and not another body, according to the works done in the
fleſh, whether they be good or bad; 2 Cor. 5.10.

p.hi: It would be rediculous that any other body ſhould be crowned, then that which ſuffered, or puniſhed, then that ſame body which ſinned.

div.p: Object. Fleſh and blood cannot inherit the kingdome of God; 1 Cor. 15.50.

Anſw. By fleſh and blood, is not meant ſimply of the body, but as it is clothed with ſin, which is in Scripture called fleſh, and indeed none living and dying, in that eſtate, can inherit Gods Kingdome; John 3.5, 6. Rom. 8.13. Gal. 5.19, 21. Epheſ. 2.3. Gal. 6.8. Col. 2.11.

div.head: The order of the Reſurrection.
div.p: The Saints ſhall riſe firſt, but every man in his own order; Chriſt the firſt fruites, afterwards they that are Chriſts at his coming; 1 Cor. 15.23.
For the Lord himſelf ſhall deſcend from Heaven with a ſhoute with the voyce of the Arch-angel, and with the Trump of God, and the dead in Chriſt ſhall riſe firſt, 1 Theſ. 4.16.

And I ſaw Thrones, and they ſate on them, and Judgement was given unto them; and I ſaw the Souls of them that were beheaded for the witneſs of Jeſus,
and for the word of God— And they lived and raigned with Chriſt 1000 years.
But the reſt of the Dead lived not again, until the 1000 years were finiſhed; This is the firſt Reſurrection; Revel. 20.4, 5.

p.hi: Laſtly, this Reſurrection will be at the laſt day, at the perſonal appearing of Chriſt.

div.p: Whoſe eateth my fleſh and drinketh my blood, hath eternal life, and I will raiſe him up at the laſt day; John 6.54.
In a moment, in the twinckling of an eye, at the laſt Trump; for the trumpet ſhall ſound and the Dead ſhall be raiſed; 1 Cor 15.52.
For if we believe that Jeſus dyed and roſe again, even ſo them alſo, which ſleep in Jeſus will God bring with him; 1 Theſ. 4.14.

div.head: Revolt.
div.p: 2 Kings 8.20. Iſa. 1.5. Hoſea 5.2. Jer. 5.23. Hoſea 9.15.

div.head: Of Riches.
div.p: The people of God ought not to ſtrive, and labour to be Rich; Prov. 23.4. 2 Kings 5.26. Jer. 45.5. Prov. 30.8. Mat. 6.25. 1 Tim. 6.10.11.

div.head: They are but Vanity.
div.p: Surely every man walketh in a vain ſhew, they are diſquieted in vain, he heapeth up Riches, and knoweth not who ſhall gather them; Pſal. 49.6.
There is one, and there is not a ſecond, yea he hath neither Child nor Brother, yet there is no end of all his labour, neither is his eye ſatisfied with Riches, this is alſo vanity; Eccleſ 4.8.
He that loveth ſilver, ſhall not be ſatisfied with ſilver, nor he that loveth abundance with increaſe, this is alſo vanity; Eccleſ. 5.10, 11.
2. Becauſe they are deceitful baits to draw away mens hearts from the Truth.
By thy wiſdome, & by thy traffique haſt thou increaſed thy Riches, and thine heart is lifted up becauſe of thy Riches; Ezek. 28.4, 5.
And the cares of this World, and the deceitfulneſs of Riches, choak the word, and it becometh unfruitful; Mat. 13.22.
But when the young man heard that ſaying, he went away ſorrowful, for he had great Poſſeſſions; Mat. 19.22.
For Demas hath forſaken me, having loved this preſent World, and is departed unto Theſſalonica; 2 Tim. 4.10.
But they that will be Rich, fall into Temptations, and a ſnare, and into many fooliſh and hurtful luſts, which drown men in deſtruction, and perdition; 1 Tim. 6.9.
3. Becauſe wealth gotten by vanity, ſhall be deminiſhed; Prov. 13.11. Job 20.15.
4. Becauſe he that maketh haſt to be Rich, ſhall not be innocent; Prov. 28.20.
5. He that haſteth to be Rich, hath an evil eye, & conſidereth not that poverty ſhall come upon him; Prov. 28.22.
6. He that oppreſſeth the poor to increaſe his Riches, and he that giveth to the Rich, ſhall ſurely come to want; Prov. 22:16.
7. He that getteth Riches, and not by right, ſhall leave them in the midſt of his dayes, & at his end ſhall he a fool; Jer. 17.11.
8. Becauſe Riches are uncertain.
Riches certainly make themſelves wings, they flee away as an Eagle toward Heaven; Pro. 23.5.
For Riches are not for ever, and doth the Crown endure to every Generation; Prov. 27.24.
Charge them that are Rich in this world, that they be not high-minded, nor truſt in uncertain Riches; 1 Tim. 6:17.
9. Riches are unprofitable.

p.hi: Becauſe there is wrath, beware leſt he take thee away with his ſtroak, then a great ranſome cannot deliver thee.

div.p: Will he eſteem thy Riches, no nor all the forces of ſtrength; Job 36:19.
They that truſt in their wealth, and boaſt themſelves in the multitude of their Riches, none of them can by any means, redeem his Brother, nor give to God a ranſome for him; Pſal. 49:6.
Riches profit not in the day of wrath, but Righteouſneſs delivereth from death; Prov. 10:2.11:4.
Their Silver, and their Gold, ſhall not be able to deliver them in the day of the Lords wrath; Ezek. 7:19. Zeph. 1:18.

div.head: The nature or property of worldly Rich men.
div.p: They are ungodly; Pſal. 73:12.
They are wiſe in their own conceit; Prov. 28.11.
Rich men are for the greateſt part of them, diſobedient to Gods Law; Jer. 5.5.22.21.
They are full of violence and are takers of Bribes; Micah 6.12.7.3.
They rule over the poor, and when they intreat, yet they anſwer Roughly; Prov. 18.23. Prov. 22 7.
They glory in their Riches, and ſet their heart upon it; Job 21.12, 13. Pſal. 62.10. Jer. 9.23. Ezek, 28:5. Pſal. 49:6.
The Poor is hated even of his neighbour, but the Rich hath many friends; Prov. 14.20. Prov. 19.4.
They make Riches their ſtrong City; Prov. 10:15. Prov. 18:11.
The abundance of the Rich will not ſuffer him to ſleep; Eccleſ. 5.12.

div.head: The danger of worldly Rich men.
div.p: The getting of treaſures, by a lying tongue is a vanity toſſed to and fro of them that ſeek Death; Prov. 21.6.
He that truſteth in his riches ſhall fall; Prov. 11:28.
The Rich man ſhall lie down, but he ſhall not be gathered, he openeth his eyes and he is not; Job 27.19.
He hath ſwallowed down Riches, and he ſhall vomit them up again, God ſhall caſt them out of his belly; Job 20:15.
Be not thou afraid when one is made Rich, when the glory of his houſe is increaſed, he ſhall go to the generation of his Fathers, they ſhall never ſee light; Pſal. 49:16, 19.
They ſhall be a Laughing-ſtock for the righteous, becauſe they truſted in their Riches; Pſal. 52:6, 7.
There is a ſore evil, which I have ſeen under the Sun, namely, Riches kept for the owners thereof to their hurt; Eccleſ. 5:13.
The Lord fils the hungry with good things, but the Rich he hath ſent empty away; Luke 1:53. 1 Sam. 2:5.
It is eaſier for a camel to go through the eye of a needle, then for a Rich man to enter into the Kingdome of God; Mat. 19.24.
It is a Dangerons thing for a Rich man to live in a ſecure eſtate; Luke 12.16, 20. Luke 16.19, 23. Pſal. 49.11, 12.
For the love of money is the root of all evil, which ſome coveting after, they have erred from the faith, and peirced themſelves through with many ſorrows; 1 Tim. 6.10.
As the Sun when it is riſen, withereth the graſs and the flower thereof falleth; So alſo ſhall the Rich man fade away in his wayes; Jam. 1.10, 11.
They ſhall weep and howl, for the miſeries that ſhall come upon them; Jam. 5.1.
Such as boaſt becauſe they are Rich, and increaſed with goods, are wretched and miſerable, and poor, and blind, and naked; Revel. 3.17.
Worldly Rich men, have all their Portion of joy, and felicity in this life; Pſal. 17:14.92.7. Luke 6.24.

div.head: The attaining of Riches.
div.p: The hand of the diligent maketh Rich; Prov. 10.4.
It is the Lord who giveth power to get wealth; Deut. 8.18.
The Lord maketh poor, and maketh Rich, he bringeth low, and lifteth up; 1 Sam. 2.7.
There is that maketh himſelf Rich, yet hath nothing, there is that maketh himſelf poor, yet hath great Riches; Prov. 13.7.
Riches and honour come of God; 1 Chron. 29:12. Eccleſ. 5:19.
The bleſſing of the Lord it maketh Rich, and he addeth no ſorrow unto it; Prov. 10.22. Job 42:12.
Solomon, by asking wiſdom and knowledge of God, had it given him with abundance of Riches, Wealth, & Honour; 2 Chron. 1:12.
By humility and the fear of the Lord are Riches, and Honour, and Life; Prov. 22.4. Pſal. 112:1, 3.
He that loveth pleaſure, ſhall be a poor man, he that loveth Wine, and Oyle, ſhall not be Rich; Prov. 21:17.
By knowledge the chambers are filled with all precious and pleaſant Riches; Pro. 24.4.

Encouragements to the Saints, and people of God, that though they be poor in the worlds Riches, yet they are exceeding Rich in the Lord; Prov. 14:24. Rom. 10:12. 1 Cor. 3.22. Epheſ. 1:18. 2 Cor. 8:9. Epheſ. 2:7. 2 Cor. 6.10. Epheſ. 3.8. Phil. 4.19. Jam. 2.5. Rev. 2.9.
The Riches of Chriſt are certain, and durable; Iſa. 23:18. Prov. 8:18. Iſa. 33.16.

div.head: Of Righteouſneſs.
div.p: Righteouſneſs commanded and exhorted to; Jer. 22:3. Dan. 9:24. Hoſea 10:12. Dan. 4.27. Zeph. 2:3. Luk. 1.75. Am. 5.24. Rom. 6.13. 1 Cor: 15:34. Eph: 6:14. 1 Tim: 6.11.

p.hi: Marks or Charecters of righteous Perſons.

div.p: They believe Gods promiſes; Gen. 15:6. Rom: 4:21, 22. Gal. 3:6.
Such are liberal to give to the relief of the poor and needy; Pſal. 112:9. 37.21.
They are ſuch as teach, and inſtruſt many in the way of God; Prov. 10:21. Pſal. 37.30.
They ſpeak the Truth; Prov. 12:17.
The fruit of the Righteous, is a tree of Life; Prov: 11:30.
The Righteous conſidereth the cauſe of the Poor, but the wicked regardeth not to know it; Prov. 29:7.
They execute true judgment in zeal to God; Pſal. 106:30, 31.
They are grieved in ſeeing, and hearing God doſhonoured by wicked mens actions; 2 Pet. 2:8.
They are obedient to all Gods Commandements; Gen. 6:22.7:1. Deut. 6:25. Luke 1.6. Heb. 11:7.

div.head: Reaſons why men ſhould be Righteous.
div.p: 1. Becauſe God is Righteous; 2 Chron. 12:6. Nehem: 1:8. Pſal: 145:17.
2. Becauſe without Righteouſneſs men are ſervants to ſin; Rom. 6.20.
3. Becauſe Righteouſneſs is a fruit of the Spirit; Epheſ. 5:9.
4. Becauſe Chriſt died for that very end; 1 Pet. 2:24.
5. Becauſe thoſe who are not Righteous are not of God; 1 John 3:10.
6. Becauſe without righteouſneſs none can enter into the kingdome of heaven; Mat. 5.20.

div.head: Encouragements to be Righteous.
div.p: Righteouſneſs exalteth a nation, But ſin is a repreach to any people; Prov. 14:34.
They are acceptable with God; Pſal. 1:6. Acts 10:35. Rom. 14:17, 18. Heb. 11:4.
The Lord is far from the wicked, but he heareth the Prayer of the Righteous; Pſal. 34:15. Prov. 15:29. Jam. 5:16.
They are the bleſſed of the Lord; Pſal: 5.12.106. 3 Mat: 5:6.
They are born of God; 1 John 2:29.
The Righteous have both hope and peace at their death; Prov: 10.28. Numb. 23:10. Prov. 14:32.
The Lord loveth righteouſneſs & righteous perſons; Pſal. 11.7. Prov. 15.9. Pſal. 146.8.
The eyes of the Lord are upon the righteous; Job 36:7. Pſal. 34:15.
The righteons are delivered out of trouble, and the wicked cometh in his ſtead; Prov. 11:8 Pſal. 37:39, 40.
The Righteous ſhall never be removed, but the wicked ſhall not inhabit the earth; Prov. 10:30. Pſal. 55:22.
The Righteous ſhall flouriſh like the palm Tree, he ſhall grow like a cedar in Lebanon; Pſal. 92.12. Job 17.9. Prov. 11.28. Pſ. 72.7, 16.
Light is ſown for the righteous, and gladneſs for the upright in heart; Pſal. 97:11.
The Lord will not ſuffer the righteous to famiſh, but he caſteth away the ſubſtance of the wicked; Prov. 10:3. Pſal. 37:25.
The righteous is more excellent then his neighbour; Prov. 12:26.
The righteous ſhall rejoyce, when he ſeeth the vengeance, he ſhall waſh his feet in the blood of the wicked; Pſal. 58:10. Mal. 3:18. Pſal. 37:32, 34.
Say ye to the righteous, it ſhall be well with him, for they ſhall eat the fruit of their doings; Iſa. 3:10.
The ſecret of the Lord is with the righteous; Prov. 3:32.
To him that ſoweth righteouſnhſs ſhall be a ſure reward; Pſal. 58:11. Prov. 11:18.31.
The Lord meets with them that rejoyce, and work righteouſneſs; Iſa. 64.5.
Treaſures of wickedneſs, profit nothing, but rightcouſneſs delivereth from death; Prov. 10:2. Prov. 11:4.
In the way of righteouſneſs is life, & in the path way thereof, there is no death; Pro. 12.28.
Open the Gates, that the righteous Nation which keepeth the truth may enter; Pſal. 37.29. Iſa. 32:17. Pſal. 15:1, 2. Prov. 21:21. Iſa: 26:2. Pſal. 118:19, 20. Iſa. 33:15, 16.
Then ſhall the righteous ſhine forth as the ſon in the kingdom of their father; Mat. 13.43

div.head: The attaining of rightcouſneſs, both internal, and external.
div.p: The internal means is to give heed to the motions, & reprovings of Gods ſpirit; Joh. 16.8.
The grace of God that bringeth ſalvation hath appeared to all men, teaching us to deny ungodlineſs, and to live ſoberly, righteouſly, & godly, in this preſent world; Tit. 2.11, 12.
The 1 external help is, to ſearch and read diligently in the Scriptures; 2 Tim. 3:16. Heb. 5:13.
The 2d. help, is to be often in the hearing Gods Word preached; Pſal. 40.9. Dan. 12.3. 2 Pet. 2.5.

div.head: Of Sanctification.
div.p: For this is the will of God, even your Sanctiffcation; 1 Theſ. 4:3.
We are ſanctificd by God the Father; 1 Theſ. 5:23. Jude 1.
Chriſt Jeſus was ſanctified by the Father, that he might Sanctifie his people; John. 10.36.17:19. 1 Cor. 1:30.
Gods people are Sanctified by the ſpirit of God; Rom 15.16. 1 Cor. 6.11. 2 Theſ. 2.13.
Sanctification is a cleanſing, and purifying from ſin; 1 Cor. 1:30. 1 Theſ. 4:3, 4. 1 John 1.9.
Sanctification is a cleanſing from ſin, by the blood of Chriſt; Heb. 10:10. Epheſ. 5.25, 26, 27. Heb. 10:29. 1 John 1.7. Heb. 13.12.

All thoſe that can truly make application to themſelves that they are Sanctified, muſt be ſuch who have crucified ſin, and live in obedience to the Commundements of God revealed in his word; Iſa. 13:3. Acts 20:32. John 17.19. Acts 26:18 1 Cor. 1:2. 1 Theſ. 4.4, 7. 1 Cor. 6:11. 1 Theſ: 5.23. 1 Pet. 1:2. Epheſ. 5:26.27. 2 Theſ. 2.13. 1 Pet. 3.15.

div.head: Scripture, Scriptures.
div.p: Reaſons or arguments to prove the Scriptures to he the word of God, and a moſt ſure and certain rule to walk by, unto which all perſons, to whom it comes, ought to take heed as unto a light that ſhineth in a dark place; 2 Tim. 3.16. 2 Pet. 1.20.
1. The divine Revelations with which they were graced from Heaven, for God was viſibly preſent, and talked with Moſes, who was the writer of the law; Exod. 20.21, 22.
2 The fulfilling of the Propheſies ſpoken of in the Scriptures, by ſeveral men in ſeveral ages.

3 The general confeſſion of the faithful Martyrs of Chriſt, who at their death did juſtifie ſo much, and willingly dyed in the defence of the truths, contained in the Scripture, Revel. 6.9. Revel. 20.4.
4 The converſion of the ſouls of men, and women, by the power of God in the Scripture; Acts 8.35, 36. Acts 17 11, 12.18.28.
5 The comfort the godly find in them, in all their troubles & afflictions, plainly proveth it to be given forth by the inſpiration of the Almighty; Pſal. 119.50, 92.
6 The miraculous calling of the men, as we may ſee in Moſes and the Apoſtles, who wrote the Scriptures
7 The internal teſtimony of it, is the the witneſs of Gods Spirit, who in the hearts of the Godly doth avouch ſo much, and this is a Teſtimony proper to the houſhold of God.

8 The Scriptures harmony is another Teſtimony to confirm this truth, it being written in ſo many ages of the world, ſo many hundreds of years at a diſtance, and written by ſo many ſeveral men, and yet to hold ſuch a harmony without contradiction, clearly argueth it to be given forth by one ſpirit, although in ſuch variety of times; 2 Pet: 1:21.

div.head: Of Seeking the Lord.
div.p: Exhortations to ſeek the Lord; 2 Chron: 16:11. Pſal: 105:4. 1 Chron: 22:19. Iſa: 8:19. Prov: 2:4. Iſa: 55:6. Cant: 3:2. Hoſea: 10:12. Amos 5.8. Zeph. 2.3. Mat. 6.33. Col: 3:1.

p.hi: The nature of ſeeking the Lord.

div.p: They muſt ſeek him with all their hearts; Deut. 4.29. 2 Chron. 15.12. Jer. 29:13.
They muſt ſeek him with their whole deſire; 2 Chron: 15:15.
They muſt ſeek the Lord betimes; Job 8:5. Prov: 8:17.
They muſt ſeek him with reſolution to keep his commandements; 2 Chron: 14.4. Ezra 7.10. 2 Chron. 17.4.
They muſt avoid ſin; Pſal. 24.6.
And follow after righteouſneſs; Iſa. 51.1.

div.head: Reaſons why.
div.p: God Created man to that end, to ſeek him; Acts 17.26, 27.
The Lord looks down from Heaven, upon the children of men, to ſee if any do underſtand and ſeek him; Pſal: 14:2.53.2.
Becauſe if they ſeek him not, when God would, when they would, God will not be found of them; Prov. 1:28. Iſa. 55:6. Hoſea 5.6. Micah 3.4.
Becauſe Gods people in old time, did ſeek the Lord; Pſal. 27.8. Ezra 7.10. Iſa: 26.9.

div.head: Encouragements to Seek God.
div.p: The danger of not ſeeking God; 2 Chron: 12:14. Pſal: 10:4. Iſa: 9:13. Pſal: 119:155. Amos 5:6. Zeph: 1:6.

div.head: Of Serving God.
div.p: Exhortations and Commands to Serve the Lord; Exod. 23.25. Deut. 6.13. 2 Chron. 30.8. Deut. 11.13. Joſh. 24.14. 1 Chron. 28.9. Deut. 13.4. 2 Chron. 35.3. 1 Sam. 12.14. Luke 1.74.

div.head: The manner of Serving God.
div.p: It muſt be with the heart; Joſh. 22.5. 1 Sam. 12.24. Deut. 10.12.
He muſt have all the Service, you cannot Serve God & Mammon; Mat. 6.24. Luk. 4.8
He muſt be Served in ſincerity and truth; Joſh. 24.14.
He muſt be Served with fervency in ſpirit; Rom. 12.11.
He muſt be Served with fear and trembling, Pſal. 2.11.
God muſt be Served with joy and gladneſs; Pſal. 100.2.
He muſt be Served in holineſs and righteouſneſs, Luke 17.5.
In righteouſneſs, peace and joy, in the holy Ghoſt; Rom. 14.18.
He muſt be ſerved with all humility of mind; Acts 20.19.
With faſting and prayer God muſt be ſerved, Luke 2. 37.
We muſt ſerve God acceptably, with reverence, and Godly fear; Heb. 12.28.

div.head: Encouragements to ſerve God.
div.p: They are Gods Jewels, and he will ſpare them as a man ſpareth his only Son, that ſerveth him; Mal. 3.17, 18.
God will ſtand by them, and deliver them in time of great tryals and ſtraits; Dan: 3.17.6.16.
They that obey and ſerve God, they ſhall ſpend their dayes in proſperity and their years in pleaſure; Job 36.11.
God will honour thoſe that ſerve him, and follow him; John 12.26.

div.head: What Sin is.
div.p: Sin is the tranſgreſſion of Gods law; Rom. 4.15. 1 Cor. 15.56. 1 John. 3.4.
All unrighteouſneſs is Sin; 1 John 5.17. Job. 1.5. Prov. 10.19.
The thought of fooliſhneſs is ſin; Pro. 24.9.

div.head: The Degrees of Sin.
div.p: The firſt begining of Sin is by beholding any object of vanity which pleaſeth the fleſh, and ſo by being inticed thereby through the pleaſantneſs of it, they imbrace it, though it be never ſo contrary to the mind of God; Ger. 3.6. Joſh. 7.21. 2 Sam. 11.2, 4. Jam. 1.15.

The 3d. degree of Sin is hardneſs of heart, that is, when perſons ſet their whole heart and mind on iniquity, and worldly things, not conſidering, nor laying to heart Gods mercies nor the latter end of thoſe wicked wayes; Iſa. 5:18. Hoſea 4:8, 11. Iſa. 42:24, 25. Ezek. 24:25. Hoſea 7:6. Iſa. 47:7. Mal. 2.2. Iſa. 57:11. Mark 3:5. Rom. 2:5.

The 4. and laſt degree of Sin, is impenitency, that is when Perſons will not reverence God, nor receive correction from him fortheir own good, neither will they receive inſtruction from him, nor from his Meſſengers, but refuſe to hearken, and wilfuly reject Gods gracious invitations, yea and make their hearts like unto an Adamant Rock; 2 Chron. 36:15.16. Iſa. 9:13.26:10. Jer. 5:3. Iſa. 28:12. Jer. 2:30. Ezek. 24:13. Iſa. 30:15, 16. Jer. 22:21. Zech. 7:11, 12. Jer. 7:26.44:16. Rom. 2:5. Epheſ. 4:19.

div.head: Of the ſevere puniſhment that hath been inflicted for Sin.
div.p: The ground was curſed for the Sin of Adam; Gen. 3:17.
Weomen bring forth children with ſorrow for Eves Sin; Gen. 3.16.
Cain was curſed for ſin; Gen. 4.11.
The world was drowned for ſin; Gen. 6.7.7.21. 1 Pet. 3:20.
Sodome and Gomorrah, deſtroyed by ſire and brimſtone from Heaven, for ſin; Gen. 19.24. 2 Pet. 2.6.
Angels were caſt down from Heaven for ſin; 2 Pet. 2.4.
For ſin, Lots wife was turned into a Pillar of Salt; Gen. 19 26.
The Levites at the Commandement of God, ſlew 3000 men for ſin; Exod: 32.28.
For Curſing, a man was ſtoned to death at the Commandement of the Lord; Levit. 24.14.
A man for gathering a few ſticks on the Sabbath, contrary to Gods Command, was ſtoned to death; Numb. 15.36.
The earth opened, and ſwallowed up alive Korah, and all that appertained to him, for Sinning againſt God; Numb. 16.32.
Achan ſtoned to death, for coveting the wedg of Gold, & a Babyloniſh garment; Joſh. 7.25.

The great army of the Iſraelites which came forth of Egypt were all deſtroyed, ſave Joſhua, and Caleb, for ſin, before they came to Canaan; Exod. 32.28. Numb. 11.1.14.37. Numb. 16.49.21.6.25.9. Numb. 31.17. Joſh. 5.6.
50000 men ſlain for looking into the Ark of God; 1 Sam. 6.19.
70000. Men devoured by the peſtilence for Davids numbring the people; 2 Sam: 24:15.
A Prophet of the Lord flain by a Lyon for ſin; 1 King. 13:26.

div.head: The danger of ſin in general.

p.hi: Helps againſt ſin, which if minded, may by Gods bleſſing abundantly prevent ſin.

div.p: Take heed to the reprovings of Gods Spirit againſt it; John 16.9.
Shun and avoid evil company; Prov. 1.10, 15. Prov. 22 24, 25.
To hide Gods word in our heart, is an excellent help abundantly to prevent ſin; Pſa. 119 11.
To have the fear of God before our faces; Exod. 20.20. Pſal. 4.4.
By not uſing many needleſs and vain words for in the multitude thereof, there wanteth not ſin; Prov. 10.19. Eccleſ. 5.2.3.
By taking heed, and watching narrowly to our hearts and to our actions; Pſ. 39.1. Heb. 3.12, 13.
By conſidering that the time paſt may ſuffice to have wrought the will of the Gentiles; 1 Pet. 4.1, 3.
By often remembring that God ſees all our actions; Hoſea 7.2.

div.head: Of our ſpirit.

p.hi: It is the duty of chriſtians to be of an humble lowly ſpirit, both towards God and man.

div.p: Towards God, Pſal: 51:17. Prov: 29:23. Mal: 2:15. Luke: 1:47.
Towards man; Prov: 16:32. Eccleſ: 7:9. Prov: 14:29. Pſal: 106:33. Prov. 25:28. Col. 3.12. Phil. 2.3.

div.head: Reaſons why.
div.p: 1 Becauſe God is the God of the ſpirits of all fleſh, & ſeeing he requires it, it is good reaſon it ſhould be ſo; Numb. 16.22. Zech. 12.1. Numb. 27.16. Heb. 12.9.
2 Becauſe God weigheth the ſpirits; Prov. 16.2.
3 Becauſe ſuch a ſpirit is in Gods ſight of great price; 1 Pet. 3.4.
4 Becauſe God will dwell in ſuch perſons by his ſpirit; Iſa. 57.15.66.2.
5 Such are bleſſed, and belong to the Kingdome of Heaven; Pſal. 34.18. Mat. 5.3. Luke 6.20.
6 Becauſe a high and lofty ſpirit, bringeth deſtruction; Prov. 16.18.

div.head: Of the Spirit of God.
div.p: But the manifeſtation of the ſpirit, is given to every man to profit withal; 1 Cor. 12.7. Job 32.8.

div.head: The nature of the Spirit.
div.p: It is of a powerful conſtraining nature; Joh 32.18. Micah 3.8.
It is of a reviving quickning nature; John 6.63. Rom. 8.11. 1 Cor. 15.45.
It is of a holy nature; Pſal. 51.11. Epheſ. 4.30. Iſa. 63.10.
It is an eternal ſpirit; Heb. 9.14.
It is of a purifying nature; 1 Pet. 1.22.
It is a Spirit of Liberty; 2 Cor. 3.17.

div.head: The offices of the Spirit.
div.p: To convince and reprove for ſin; Gen. 6.3. John 16.8.
To teach and inſtruct perſons in the way of truth; Nehem. 9.20. Micah 2.7. 2 Tim. 1.7. John. 14.26.
To revive, and comfort Gods people; Iſa. 57.15. John. 14.16.
To guide us into all truth, and ſhew us things to come; John 16.13.
To reveal the deep things of God, 1 Cor. 2.11, 12. Epheſ. 3.5.
To bear witneſs with our Spirit, that we are the children of God; Rom. 8.16. Gal. 4.6.
The Spirit makes interceſſion for the Saints with groans, which cannot by us be uttered; Rom. 8.26, 27.
Thereby we are ſealed unto the day of redemption; Epheſ. 4.30. 2 Cor. 1.22. Epheſ. 1.13, 14.
It helps to mortifie ſin by walking in the ſpirit; Rom. 8.13:2 Cor. 3.18. Gal. 5.16.
We have acceſs through the ſpirit to the Father; Epheſ. 2.18.
We are an habitation for God through the ſpirit; Epheſ. 2:22.
We are ſtrengthened by the ſpirit in the inward man, through the riches of Gods grace; Epheſ. 3.16.
We wait for the hope of righteouſneſs thereby; Gal: 5:5.
The fruits of the ſpirit; Gal: 5:22. Epheſ 5:9.

div.head: The attaining of the ſpirit.
div.p: It is Gods free gift; 2 Cor. 5.5.
It is obtained by faith; John 7:39. Epheſ: 1:13 Gal: 3:2.
By ſetting a very high eſteem of it above all things in the world, for the reaſon why, the world cannot receive it, is becauſe they know it not; John 14:17. 1 Cor: 2:14.
By prayer, and confident perſwaſion therewith, that he will give in, Luke 11:13.

div.head: Steal, Stealeth.
div.p: Ezod: 22:1. Levit: 19:11. Exod: 21:16. Deut: 24:7. Prov: 6.30. Jer. 7.9. Prov. 30.9. Hoſea 4.2. Zech. 5.3. John 10.10. Epheſ. 4.28.

div.head: Thought, Thoughts.
div.p: The Lord knoweth the thoughts of all men; Job 42.2. Pſal. 139:2. 1 Chron. 28:9. Pſal. 94:11. Amos 4:13. Mat. 9:4.12:25. 1 Cor. 3:20.

div.head: God is a God of Truth.
div.p: Chriſt is the way, the truth, and the life; John 14:6. Pſal. 45:4. John 1:17.5:33. 1 John 5:20. Revel. 3:7.
The ſpirit of God is the truth; John 14.17.15:26.17:13. 1 John 2:27.5:6.
The Goſpel, the Word, and the Commandements of God, is the truth; Pſal. 25:10. Dun. 10:21. Pſal. 57:10. John 17.17. Gal. 3:1.5.7. Pſal. 119:148, 151. Epheſ. 1:13. Col. 1:5. 2 Tim. 2.15. Nehem. 9.13.
Gods promiſes, his wayes & workes are all truth; Gen. 24:27. 1 Sam: 7:28. Dan. 4.37. Pſal. 25:10. Mark 12.14. Revel. 15.3. Iſa. 25.1.
His judgments are truth; Rom. 2:2. Revel. 19.2.
Men ought to ſpeak the truth; Pſal. 15.2. Prov. 12:17. Jer. 9:5. Zech. 8:16. 2 Cor. 4.2: Epheſ. 4:25.

div.head: Exhortations to ſerve God in Truth.
The Charecters of perſons, which ſerve and obey God in Truth.
div.p: The Charecters of thoſe who do not ſerve and obey the truth, Iſa. 59:15. Jer. 5:3.7.28. Rom. 1.25. 1 Tim. 5:6.
The danger of thoſe who obey not the truth; Hoſea 4.1. Joh. 8.44. Rom. 2.8. 2 Theſ. 2.10.
Encouragements to obey the truth; Pſal. 145.18. Prov. 12.19. Iſa. 26.2. Jer. 5:1. Iſa. 38.3, 5. John 8.32. Pſal: 91.4.

div.head: Of Truſting in God. Exhortations to Truſting in God.
Encouragements to truſt in God.
div.p: Such are bleſſed; Pſal. 2.12.34.8. Prov. 16.20. Pſal. 40.4.84.12. Jer. 17.7.
He is a ſheild and buckler to them that truſt in him; Pſal. 28.7.115.9. 2 Sam. 22.13. Pſal. 18.30. Prov. 30.5.
God defendeth them that truſt in him; Pſal. 5.11. Jer. 39.18.
He ſaves them from their enemies; Pſal: 17.7.37.40.
God will give them the deſires of their heart; Pſal 37 5.112.7, 8.
He that putteth his truſt in the Lord, ſhall be made Fat; Prov. 29.25.
They ſhall be ſafe who truſt in the Lord; Prov. 28.25.
Their light ſhall break our of darkneſs; Iſa. 50.10.
They ſhall be as Mount Sion, which cannot be moved, but abideth for ever; Pſal. 125.1.
Mercy ſhall compaſs them about; Pſal. 32.10.
Their heart ſhall rejoyce, who truſt in the Lord; Pſal. 33.21.
They have boldneſs to plead their caſe with God; Pſal. 25.20.71.1. Pſal. 143.8.
The 3 Children by truſting in the Lord were delivered from the burning fiery Furnace; Dan. 3.28.
The Lord is a ſtrong hold, in the dayes of trouble, and he knoweth them that put their truſt in him; Naham 1.7.
Such ſhall be kept in perfect peace; Iſa. 26.3.
None who truſt in the Lord, ſhall be deſolate; Pſal. 34.22.
It is a plea for deliverance in the time of trouble, from former experience of Gods dealing with thoſe who did truſt in him; Pſ. 22.4.
They who truſt in God are kept under the ſhadow of his wings; Ruth 2.12.
They who truſt in the Lord, ſhall inherit Glory; Pſal: 31:19. Iſa: 57:13.

div.head: The nature of Truſting in God.
div.p: They truſt in God with all their heart, & lean not to their own underſtanding; Pro. 3.5.
They muſt truſt in God alwayes at all times; Pſal: 62:8.
In the midſt of reproaches, wrongs, and ſlanders, Gods people put their truſt in God; Pſal. 31.11, 12, 13, 14.
It is of an carneſt nature, for though God ſlay them, yet they will truſt in him; Job 13.15
In time of fear they truſt in God and are not afraid what man can do unto them; Pſal. 56.3, 4.
They rejoyce and glory in the Lord; Pſal. 44.6, 7, 8. Pſal. 64.10.
They reſpect not the proud, nor ſuch as turn aſide to lyes; Pſal. 40.4.
Such grow in the houſe of God like green Olive trees; Pſal. 52.8.
They make the Lord to be their hope; Pſal. 71.5. Jer. 17.7.
Such do good and commit their way unto the Lord; Pſal. 37.3, 5.
They are not afraid of evil tidings, their heart is firmly fixed, truſting in the Lord; Pſal. 112.7, 8.
Such who truſt in God, labour in the work of God; 1 Tim. 4.10.
They are frequent in ſupplications and in Prayers to God; 1 Tim. 5:5.
They adorn themſelves not in rich attire, but in modeſt apparel; 1 Pet. 3:5.

div.head: Reaſons why Perſons ſhould truſt in the Lord.
div.p: Becauſe judgment is before him, therefore truſt in him; Job 35:14.
Becauſe it is better to truſt in the Lord, then to put conſidence in man; Pſal. 118:8, 9.
Becauſe ſuch who truſt in God gloriſie him; Epheſ. 1:12.
Becauſe Gods wrath is againſt thoſe who do not put their truſt in him; Pſal. 78:21, 22.
Becauſe woe will be to thoſe who truſt not in the Lord; Zeph: 3:2.

div.head: What Gods people muſt not put truſt nor confidence in.
div.p: Not in Chariots, and Horſes; Pſal. 20:7.
Not in Bow, or Sword; Pſal. 44:6.
Not in Man, no not Princes; Pſal. 118:8, 9. Jer: 17:5. Pſal. 146:3.
Not in Riches, nor in the abundance of Wealth; Mark 10:24. Pſal: 49:6. 1 Tim: 6.17. Pſal: 52:7.
Not in vanity, nor lying words, which will not profit; Iſa. 59:4. Jer. 7:4.
Evil men truſt in wickedneſs, which the people of God muſt not do; Iſa. 47:10. Jer. 13.25. Pſal, 62:10.
They muſt not truſt in their works; Jer. 48.7.
They muſt not truſt in their own righteouſneſs; Luke 18:9.
They muſt not truſt to their own heart; Prov: 28:26.

div.head: The danger of truſting in any thng but in the Lord.
div.p: They are curſed; Jer: 17:5.
Their hope and truſt ſhall be as a ſpiders web; Job: 8:14.
They ſhall fall; Prov: 11:28.
They are fools; Prov: 28:26.
Such ſhall have a woful portion from the Lord; Jer: 13:25.48:7.
They may cry to God but he will not hear them; Iſa. 57:13.
They ſhall not enter into the Kingdome of God; Mark 10:24.

div.head: Helps to truſting in God.
div.p: By conſidering the excellent loving kindneſs of God; Pſal: 36:7.
Experience of Gods gracious dealing ſhould teach it; Pſal: 22:4.40:3.
By coming to know God, men truſt in him; Pſal. 9.10.
Excellent things were written to that end that men might put their truſt in the Lord; Prov: 22:19.20.
By hearing the word of truth, the Goſpel of Salvation; Epheſ: 1:13.

div.head: Vertue
div.p: Prov. 12.14. Ruth 3.11. Prov. 31.10. Maris 5.30. Luke 6.19, Phil. 4.8. 2 Pet. 1.3:5.

div.head: What underſtanding is.
div.p: The fear of the Lord, that is wiſdone, and to depart from evil, is underſtanding; Job 28:28.
A good underſtanding have all they that do his Commandements; Pſal: 111:10.
The knowledg of God is true underſtanding; Prov: 9:10.

div.head: The nature of underſtanding.
div.p: They are wiſe; Prov: 17:24.10.13.14.33.
Such ſpare their words, and are of an excellent Spirit; Prov: 17:27, 28.
They walk uprightly; Prov: 15:21.
Knowledge is eaſie to them that underſtand; Prov: 14:6. Prov: 8:9.
They are forſakers of fooliſhneſs, who walk in the way of underſtanding; Prov: 9:6.

div.head: The charecters of perſons void of underſtanding.
div.p: They are adulterers; Prov: 6:32.

With the fair ſhews, and flattering ſpeeches
of ſin they yeeld to it; Prov. 7.7, 21.
They keep company with vain and fooliſh perſons; Prov. 12.11.
They give way to their own fooliſh heart; Prov 18.2.
They are ſlothful in the wayes of God; Prov. 24.30, 31.
They are great oppreſſors, through covetouſweſs; Prov. 28.16.
They fear not God; Jer. 5.21, 22.
They are actors of wickedneſs, and all unrighteouſneſs, which can be named; Rom. 1.30, 31. Epheſ. 4.18.

div.head: The excellency of underſtanding.
div.p: Perſons of underſtanding attain unto wiſe counſels; Prov. 1.5.
It makes perſons happy; Prov. 3.13.
It will when once attained, keep and preſerve perſons from the way of evil men; Prov. 2.11, 12.
It is of more worth then gold, or Silver, Prov. 3.14.16.16.
It is a well-ſpring of life unto thoſe who have it; Prov. 16.22.
And he that keepeth it ſhall find good; Pro. 19.8.
Through wiſdome is an houſe builded, and by underſtanding it is eſtabliſhed; Pro. 24.3.

p.hi: Reaſons why perſons ſhould embrace underſtanding.

div.p: 1 Becauſe they are exhorted to it; Prov. 4.7.5.1. Prov. 7.4.8.5. Prov. 9 6. 1 Cor. 14.20. Pſal. 47.7. Epheſ. 5.17.
2 Becauſe it was tht Apoſtles prayer, that the Saints might have underſtanding; Eph. 1.18. Col. 1.9. 2 Tim. 2.7.
3 Becauſe God looks down from Heaven, to ſee if there be any that underſtand and ſeek God; Pſal. 14.2.53.2.
The danger of the want of underſtanding. A rod is for the back of thoſe who are void of it; Prov. 10.13.
Such remain in the congregation of the dead; Prov. 21.16.
Men that want it though in honour here, are like the beaſts that periſh; Pſal. 49.20.
They who want it, deſtroy their own ſoul; Prov. 6.32.
The people that do not underſtand ſhall fall; Hoſea 4.14.
God will have no mercy on ſuch, and he that formed them will ſhew them no favour; Iſa, it; Job 27.11.

div.head: The attaining of underſtanding.
div.p: It is the inſpiration of the Almighty giveth it; 32.8.38.36. Prov. 2.6.
By for ſaking fooliſhneſs; Prov. 9 6.
Reproofs many times is the way to bread it; Prov. 15.32.
It is attained by fervent prayer; 1 King: 3:9, 12. Pſal. 119:34. Prov: 2:3, 5.
By hearinng, reading, and meditating in the Law of God; Pſal: 119:99, 100. Nehem: 8:8. Pſal: 119:130.

div.head: Of Uprightneſs.
div.p: Uprigh tneſs is purity, or ſincerity, in oppoſition to vanity and hypocriſie; Job 8:6. 12:4. Job 17:8. 33:3.

div.head: Uprightneſs or ſincerity, conſiſteth in two things.
div.p: 2 In life and converſation; Pſal: 37:14. Prov: 2:13.

div.head: The charecters of an upright man, is as followeth.
div.p: They eſchew and avoid ſin; Pſal: 18:23. 2 Sam: 22:24. Pſal: 19:13. Job 1:1. Prov: 16.17. Hab: 2:4.
They fear the Lord; Job 1.1. Prov: 14:2.
They love the Lord; Cant: 1:4.
They keep the Commandements of God; 1 King: 9:4.
They endure Tryals patiently, and hold faſt their integrity; Job 2:3.
They take heed to their wayes, whilſt wicked men harden their faces; Prov: 21:29.
They walk according to the rule of the Goſpel; Gal: 2:14.

div.head: Reaſons why Gods ſervants ſhould be upright.
div.p: Becauſe God is upright, Pſal: 25:8.92:15. Iſa: 26:7.
Becauſe the Lord miniſters Judgment to his people in uprightneſs; Pſal: 9:8.
Becauſe God made man upright, though he hath ſought out many inventions; Eccleſ. 7.29.
Becauſe all Gods works are done in truth and uprightneſs; Pſal: 111:8.
Becauſe the word of God is upright; Eccleſ. 12:10.
Becauſe the want of uprightneſs is complained of by the people of God; Micah 7:2.
Becauſe heaven is a Land of uprightneſs; Pſal: 143:10.
Becauſe ſuch are Gods delight; Prov. 11.20. 1 Chron. 29:17.
Becauſe God delighteth in ther Prayers; Prov: 15.8.

div.head: Encouragements to the Upright.
div.p: The Tabernacle of the upright ſhall flouriſh; Prov. 14.11. Pſal. 112.2. Prov. 28.10.
Ʋnto ſuch there ariſeth light in darkneſs; Pſal. 112.4.
Gladneſs is ſown for the upright in heart; Pſal: 97.11.
No good thing will God with-hold from ſuch; Pſal. 84.11.
He is a Buckler to them that walk uprightly; Prov. 2.7.
The Words, and Ordinances of God are ſtrength to the upright; Job 8:7, 8. Prov. 10.20. Job 17:8, 9. Micah 2:7.
Such walk ſurely; Prov. 10:9.
The countenance of the Lord, doth behold the upright; Pſal. 11:7.
They ſhall have Dominon over the wicked; Pſal. 49:14.
The righteous ſhall be glad in the Lord, and all the upright in heart ſhall glory; Pſal. 64:10.
Their integrity, and uprightneſs guides and delivers them; Prov. 13:3.
The wicked ſhall be a Ranſome for the righteous, and the tranſgreſſour for the upright, Prov. 21:18.
They are better, though poor, then perverſe men, though they be rich; Prov. 28.6.
By the bleſſing of the upright, the City is exalted; Prov. 11:11.
Righteouſneſs keepeth them that are upright in the way; Prov. 12.6.13.6.
It encourages Perſons to plead with God; Pſal. 36 10.25.21.
It is commendable, and brings Praiſe; 1 Sam. 29.6.
With the upright man, God will ſhew himſelf upright; 2 Sam. 22.26. Pſal. 18.25.
Mark the perfect man, and behold the upright, for the end of that man is peace; Pſal. 37.37. Iſa. 57.2.
Such who walk uprightly ſhall dwell in Gods preſence, in the Kingdom of Heaven; Pſal. 15.2. Prov. 2.21. Pſal. 7.10.37.18. Iſa. 33.15. Pſal. 140.13. Prov. 28.18.

div.head: Wail, Wailing.
div.p: Eſther 4.3. Jer. 9.10. Ezek. 7.11. Amos 5.16. Ezek. 27.31. Micah 1.8. Revel. 1.7. Mat. 13.42. Revel. 18.15.

div.head: Of waiting on God.
div.p: Exhortations to waiting on God; Pſal. 27.14. Iſa. 42.4. Pſal. 52.9. Jer. 14.22. Iſa. 51.5. Pſal. 33.20. Hoſea 12.6. Iſa. 60.9. Zeph. 3.8.

div.head: What we muſt wait for.
div.p: For the conſolation of Iſrael; Luke 2.25.
For the Kingdome of God; Mark 15.43.
For the promiſe of the Father: Acts 1.4.
For the hope of righteouſneſs by faith; Gal. 5.5.
For the Salvation of God; Gen. 49.18. Lam. 3.26.
For the redemption of our body; Rom. 8.23.
For the coming of Chriſt; 1 Cor. 1.7. 1 Theſ. 1.10. 2 Theſ. 3.5.

p.hi: The charecters of true waiters upon God.

div.p: They keep his way; Pſal. 37.34.
In the way of his own Judgments; Iſa. 26.8.
They wait upon God, even under Judgments, when he hides his face from them; Iſa. 8.17.
To be in a ready poſture like ſervants, waiting for their Lords return from the wedding; Luke 12.36.
They wait earneſtly, as ſervants eyes are upon their Maſters, ſo do they wait until he have mercy on them; Pſal. 12.3.2.
They wait with more earneſtneſs, and deſire then watch-men do, for the morning; Pſal. 130.6.

p.hi: The manner of waiting on God.

div.p: They muſt wait quietly; Lam. 3.26.
They muſt wait patiently; Pſal. 37.7.40. 1. Rom. 8.25. Jam. 5.7.2 Theſ. 3.5.
They muſt wait believingly; Hab. 2.3. Gal. 5.5.
They muſt wait earneſtly; Pſal. 69.3.
They muſt wait continually; Hoſea 12.6. Job 14.14.

p.hi: Reaſons why we muſt wait upon the Lord.

div.p: Becauſe God waits to be gracious to his people, yea to rebellious ſinners; Iſa. 30.18. 1 Pet. 3.20.
Becauſe our expectation is from him; Pſal. 62.5.
Becauſe of the ſtrength of our enemies; Pſal. 59.9.
Becauſe friends may fail, but by waiting upon God he will hear when none elſe will; Micah 7.7.8.
Becauſe he is a God of judgment; Iſa. 30.18.

p.hi: Encouragements to wait upon the Lord.

div.p: Such ſhall not be aſhamed; Pſal. 25.3. Iſa. 49.23. Pſal. 69.6.
It is the way to have our heart ſtrengthened; Pſal. 27.14.
They are bleſſed; Iſa. 30.18.
God is their defence; Pſal. 59.9.
They that wait upon the Lord, ſhall renew their ſtrength, they ſhall walk & not be weary, they ſhall run, and not faint; Iſa. 40:31.
The Lord is good to them that wait for him; Lam, 3.25.
They are bleſſed; Prov. 8.34.
God will hear their Prayers; Micah 7.7. Pſal. 40.1.
It is a ſtrong plea, for Salvation; Iſa. 26.9.33.2. Pſal. 25.21.
They underſtand the Diſpenſations of God, when others do not; Zech. 11.11.
Such ſhall be honoured; Prov. 27.18.
They have God to be their help, and ſhield; Pſal. 33.20.
Such who wait on the Lord, ſhall inherit the earth; Pſal. 37.9.
Such who wait on the Lord, and keep his way, ſhall inherit the Land, when the wicked are cut off, they ſhall ſee it; Pſal. 37.34.
Such ſhall be ſaved; Prov. 20.22.
Ear hath not heard, nor eye ſeen, but the Lord, what he hath prepared for thoſe that wait upon him; Iſa. 64.4.

div.head: Reaſons why it is the duty of all people, but eſpecially the people of God, to be upon their watch.
div.p: 1. Becauſe the coming of Chriſt is uncertain; Mat. 24:42.25:13. Mark 13:35.
2. Becauſe it is a means to eſcape Sins Temptation; Mat: 26:41. Mark 14.38. Luke 21:36.
3. Becauſe it is the way to eſcape and prevent being perverted by falſe teachers, and cunning deceivers, who will & do draw many from the truth; Act. 20:30, 31. 2 Tim. 4.4, 5.
4. Becauſe the end of all things is at hand; 1 Pet. 4:7.
5. Becauſe it is a means to be ſtrong in the faith; 1 Cor. 16:13. Epheſ. 6:10, 18.
6. Becauſe Gods people of old were in this duty; Pſal. 102:7.141:3. Hab: 2:1.
7. Becauſe if we do not, Chriſt will come to ſuch as a thief in the night; Revel: 3:3.

div.head: Encouragements to Watchfulneſs.
div.p: They who watch and keep their garments white are bleſſed; Revel. 16:15. Pro: 8:34.
Thoſe whom Chriſt when be comes ſinds watching, ſhall be exceedingly honoured; Luke 12:37. Mat: 24:42, 47.

div.head: Of Gods Will.
div.p: Wherefore be ye not unwiſe, but underſtanding what the will of the Lord is; Epheſ. 5:17.

div.head: What Gods will is.
div.p: It is Gods will all ſhould come to Repentance and be ſaved; Ezek: 33:11. Mat: 18:14. 1 Tim: 2:4. 2 Pet: 3:9.
It is Gods will that every true beleever in Chriſt, ſhould have evelaſting life; Joh. 6.40.
It is his will that Chriſt ſhould raiſe them up all at the Laſt day; John 6:39.
It is Gods will perſons ſhould live a godly holy life, and not according to the luſts of the fleſh; Joh. 1:13. 1 Theſ: 4:3.
Rejoyce evermore, pray without ceaſing, in every thing give thanks, for this is the will of God in Chriſt Jeſus, concerning you; 1 Theſ. 5:16, 17, 18.
It is the will of God that with well doing by a holy converſation, we put to ſilence the ignorance of fooliſh men; 1 Pet. 2:15.
It is Gods will, that his people ſhould not be conformable to this world, nor the things thereof, but transformed, that is to ſay, changed, or out of love with it; Rom. 12:2. 1 John 2:15.

div.head: The Reaſons why perſons muſt be obedient to Gods will.
div.p: 1. Becauſe Chriſt came to ſuffer and to perform all the will of God for our ſakes; John 4:34.5:30. Gal: 1:4. Heb. 10:7. 1 Pet. 4:1, 2.
2. Becauſe the Apoſtles prayed fervently for the Saints compleating in all the will of God; Col. 1:9.4:12. Heb 13:21.
3. Becauſe they are exhorted to it; Rom. 12:1, 2.
4. Becauſe not every one that ſaith Lord, Lord, ſhall enter into the Kingdom of Heaven, but he that doth the will of our Father which is in Heaven; Mat. 7:21.
5. Becauſe ſuch who know the will of God and do it not, ſhall be beaten with many ſtripes; Luke 12:47. Rom. 2:18, 23.

div.head: Encouragements to thoſe who live in obedience to the will of God.
div.p: They are Gods ſons and daughters; Iohn 1:12, 13. Mat. 12:50.
They who do the will of God, ſhall be of a diſcerning ſpirit, to know Gods Doctrine from any others; John 7:17.
God will hear the prayers of ſuch; John 9:31.
The world paſſeth away, and the luſt thereof, but he that doth the will of God abideth for ever; 1 John 2:17.
Such have a ſtrong plea, to reſign the keeping of their ſouls to God, 1 Pet: 4:19.
The promiſes of God belong to thoſe who do the will of God; Heb: 10:36.

div.head: Of Wiſdome.
div.p: There is a twofold wiſdome in men; for men may have a carnal, earthly, ſenſual, worldly wiſdome; and yet not have the wiſdome that is from above; but be under the wrath and ſore diſpleaſure of the Lord, for he doth hate and abhor this Wiſdome, which indeed is not wiſdome, though it be counted ſo by worldly men; Job 5.13. Iſa: 19.11. Jer: 4.22.8.9. Iſa: 10.13.29.14. Jer. 9.23. Ezek. 28.5. Iſa. 47.10. Jer. 49.7. Zech, 9.2. Luke 16.8. 1 Cor: 1.19.2.6. 1 Cor. 3.19. 2 Cor. 1.12. Jam. 3.16.

div.head: What true Wiſdome is.
div.p: The fear of the Lord that is wiſdome, and to depart from evil is underſtanding; Job 28.28. Pſal. 111.10. Prov. 1.7. Prov. 9.10.
It is wiſdome to do, and keep the Commandements of God; Deut. 4.6.

div.head: Charecters of Wiſdome.
div.p: Wiſe men will hear and will increaſe in learning; Prov. 1.5.10.5.
They will hearken unto counſel; Prov. 12.15 Prov. 9.9.
The law of the wiſe, is a fountain of life, to depart from the ſnares of death; Prov. 13.14.15.24.
They diſperſe knowledge aright; Prov: 15.2, 7. Eccleſ. 12 9.
In the multitude of words there wanteth not ſin, but he that refraineth his lips is wiſe, Prov. 10.19.
The words of a wiſe mans mouth are gracious; Eccleſ. 10.12.
They ſeek after knowledge; Prov. 18.15.
They are well adviſed; Prov. 13.10.
They are lowly perſons; Prov. 11.2.
They are juſt perſons; Luke 1.17.
There is Oyl in the dwellings of the wiſe, that is grace in the heart, but fooliſh perſons ſpendit all up; Prov. 21.20. Mat. 25.3, 4.
Reproofs enter more into ſuch, then 100 ſtripes into a fool; Prov. 17.10. Prov. 9.8.
The wiſdome which is from above, is pure, peaceable, gentle, & eaſie to be intreated, full of mercy, and good fruits, without partiallity, and hypocriſie; Jam: 3:17.
They are not reſpecters of perſons in judgment; Prov: 24:23.
They are ſtrong in grace, and yet they increaſe; Prov: 24:5.
They fear and depart from evil; Prov: 14:16.
They keep Gods law; Prov: 28:7.
They build their houſe upon a rock; Mat: 7:24.
The heart of the wiſe is in the houſe of mourning; Eccleſ: 7:4.
They conſider their latter end; Deut: 32:29. Pſal: 90:12.
They walk uprightly; Pſal: 101:2.
And circumſpectly; Epheſ: 5:15. Col: 4.5, 6.

div.head: The excellency of wiſdome.
div.p: Gold, Silver, nor precious Stones, nor Rubies, nor coſtly Pearls, is not to compare with it for worth, Prov: 8:11. Job 28:15, 16, 17, 18. Prov: 3:14, 15. Prov. 16.16.
It excelleth folly, as far as light excelleth darkneſs; Eccleſ. 2.13.
It is as ſweet as honey to the taſte; Prov. 24.13, 14.
It is the principal thing that may be gotten; Prov. 4.7.
We ſhould call it our ſiſter, and kinſ-woman; Prov. 7.4.
It teacheth excellent things; Prov. 8.1, 6.

div.head: The uſe of wiſdome.
div.p: It helps to govern Kingdoms; 2 Chron. 1.10.
It preſerves and delivers from the way of evil, Prov. 2.10, 11, 12.
It is mighty uſeful in war; Prov. 24.6. Eccleſ. 9.15.
It is profitable to direct; Eccleſ. 10.10. Pſal. 107.43.
It ſtrengtheneth the Wiſe more then ten men which are in a city; Eccleſ. 7.19.
It ſcaleth the walls of the mighty, and caſteth down the ſtrength of the confidence thereof; Prov. 21.22.
It teacheth to diſcern both time and judgment; Eccleſ 8.5.
It is uſeful to teach and inſtruct one another; Col. 1.28.
It will ſtop the mouths of gain-ſayers; Acts 6.10.

div.head: Encouragements to be Wiſe.
div.p:
Such ſhall underſtand great things when the wicked ſhall fall and not underſtand;
Pſal: 107:43. Dan. 12:10. Hoſea 14:9.
They are profitable unto themſelves; Job 22.2. Prov. 9:12.
They ſhall have a reward, and ſhall not loſe their expectation; Prov. 24:14.
Such love their own ſoul, and ſhall find good; Prov: 19:8.
It giveth life to them that have it; Eccleſ. 7:12. Prov: 3:21, 22.
It is Commendable; Prov: 12:8.
Such are happy; Prov: 3:13.
Their lips preſerve them; Prov. 14:3.
They ſhall inherit glory; Prov. 3:35.
Fools ſhall be ſervants to the Wiſe in heart; Prov: 11.29.
They ſhall go in with Chriſt to the Marriage; Mat. 25:10.
They ſhall ſhine in glory as the brightneſs of the Firmament; Dan. 12:3.

div.head: Danger of wanting Wiſdom.
div.p: Such love death; Prov. 8.36.
Men die for want of Wiſdom; Prov. 10.21.
Such are complained of; Pſal. 36:3. Jer. 8:9. Pſal. 94.8.
Such ſhall be ſhut out of the Kingdom of Heaven; Mat: 25:12.

div.head: The attaining of Wiſdom.
div.p: It is God who giveth it; 1 King. 3:12. Job 11.6. Pſal. 51:6. Pro. 2:6. Eccleſ. 2.26. Dan. 2:21.
Many times the reproofe of men, and the Rod together, cauſeth Wiſdom; Prov. 29:15.21:11.
By hearing counſel, and receiving Inſtruction; Prov. 19.20.
By walking with Wiſe men; Prov. 13.20.
Wiſdom is obtained by earneſt and fervent prayer to God; Prov. 8.17. 1 Kings 3.12. Jam. 1.5.
By being frequent in ſearching the Scriptures, and Meditating in them; Pſal. 19.7.119.98. 2 Tim. 3.15.
The mouth of the righteous teacheth Wiſdom; Pſal. 37.30.105.22.

div.head: What the word of God is.
The Scripture is the word of God.
The excellency of the word of God.
The nature of the word of God.
The power of the word of God.
The uſe of the word of God.
The manner of receiving the word of God aright.
The certainty of the word of God.
The continuance of the word of God.
The danger of the neglecting the word of God.
Encouragements to keep and obey the word of God.
The way to keep and attain the word of God, ſo as to do it.
